Chapter 1.1 | Intro to complex numbers

Def | Field

A field is a set of elements equipped with a + operation and a x operation

Those operations satisfy
i.) Closure
âx,yâF\forall x, y \in Fâx,yâF
a.)x+yâFa.) x+y \in Fa.)x+yâF
b.)xâyâFb.) x\cdot y \in Fb.)xâyâF

ii.) Commutative Property
a.)x+y=y+xa.) x+y = y+xa.)x+y=y+x
b.)xây=yâxb.) x\cdot y = y\cdot xb.)xây=yâx

iii.) Associative Property
a.)(x+y)+z=x+(y+z)a.) (x+y)+z = x + (y+z)a.)(x+y)+z=x+(y+z)
b.)(xây)z=x(yâz)b.) (x\cdot y)z = x(y\cdot z)b.)(xây)z=x(yâz)

iv.) Identity Element
a.)x+I+=xa.) x+I_{+} = xa.)x+Iâ+ââ=x
b.)xâIÃ=xb.) x\cdot I_{\times} = xb.)xâIâÃââ=x

v.) Inverse Element
a.)x+N+(x)=I+a.) x + N_{+}(x) = I_{+}a.)x+Nâ+ââ(x)=Iâ+ââ
b.)xâNÃ(x)=IÃb.) x\cdot N_{\times}(x) = I_{\times}b.)xâNâÃââ(x)=IâÃââ

vi.) Distributive Property
c(a+b)=ac+bcc(a+b) = ac + bcc(a+b)=ac+bc

Example 1 | Verify that R\mathbb{R}R is a field

i.) âx,yâRâx+yâR\forall x,y\in\mathbb{R} \rightarrow x+y \in \mathbb{R}âx,yâRâx+yâR ^ xyâRxy \in \mathbb{R}xyâR
ii.) âx,yâRâx+y=y+x\forall x,y\in\mathbb{R} \rightarrow x+y = y+xâx,yâRâx+y=y+x ^ xy=yxxy=yxxy=yx
iii.) Associative and so on

iv.) a.)x+0=xI+=0a.) x+0 = x\qquad I_{+}=0a.)x+0=xIâ+ââ=0
b.)xÃ1=xIÃ=0\quad b.) x\times 1 = x\qquad I_{\times}=0b.)xÃ1=xIâÃââ=0

v.) a.)x+âx=0N+=âxa.) x+ -x = 0 \qquad N_{+}=-xa.)x+âx=0Nâ+ââ=âx
b.)x+(1/x)=1NÃ=(1/x)\quad b.) x+ (1/x) = 1 \qquad N_{\times} = (1/x)b.)x+(1/x)=1NâÃââ=(1/x)

Example 2 | Is Z\mathbb{Z}Z a field?

2âZ2\in\mathbb{Z}2âZ
2â(1/2)=1?2\cdot (1/2) = 1?2â(1/2)=1?
but 1/2âZ so Z1/2 \notin \mathbb{Z}\space so\space \mathbb{Z}1/2âZ so Z is not a field

Complex Numbers C\mathbb{C}C

The set of complex numbers C\mathbb{C}C consists of elements of the form
a+bi\qquad\qquad a+bia+bi
where a,bâRa,b\in\mathbb{R}a,bâR and i2=â1i^2 = -1iâ2ââ=â1
a - real part
b - imaginary part

â*âoperations
â\bulletâ Addition
(a+bi)+(c+di)(a+bi) + (c+di)(a+bi)+(c+di)
=(a+c)+(b+d)i=(a+c) + (b+d)i=(a+c)+(b+d)i \qquad (a+c)(a+c)(a+c) is real part (b+d)i\quad (b+d)i(b+d)i is imaginary part

â\bulletâ Multiplication
(a+bi)(c+di)=ac+adi+bci+bdi2(a+bi)(c+di) = ac+adi+bci+bdi^2(a+bi)(c+di)=ac+adi+bci+bdiâ2ââ
=(acâbd)+(ad+bc)i=(ac-bd)+(ad+bc)i=(acâbd)+(ad+bc)i
